attributes.action: Increase the Defence budget by the £10bn Lord Guthrie, who was Chief of Defence Staff during the first four years of Tony Blair's premiership, has said is needed.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Army have a major problem with retention and recruitment. The RAF is short of personnel in skilled trades and the Royal Navy has stopped all promotions above the rank of commander as a cost cutting measure. Not to mention the reduction of units in current and future acquisitions, the mothballing of capabilities and the lack of funding for unglamorous items such as spare parts and training. The armed forces will never say no. They will always do their duty. They deserve the best and we, the public, have a duty to ensure the government provides this and the opposition hold them to account.
